au.com.codeka.carrot.expr

Class Tokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.codeka.carrot.expr.Tokenizer

  • public class Tokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts an input Reader into a stream of Tokens.

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public boolean accept(TokenType... types)
               throws CarrotException
        Returns true if the current token is and of the given TokenTypes. You can then use expect(au.com.codeka.carrot.expr.TokenType...) to get the token (and advance to the next one).
        Parameters:
        types - The TokenType we want to accept.
        Returns:
        True, if the current token is of the given type, or false it's not.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - If there's an error parsing the tokens.

      • accept

        public boolean accept(int offset,
                      TokenType type)
               throws CarrotException
        Returns true if the token at the given offset from the current is of the given TokenType. The 0th token is the current one, the 1st is the after that and so on. This can be used to "look ahead" into the token stream.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset from "current" that we want to peek. 0 is the current token, 1 is the next and so on.
        type - The TokenType we want to accept.
        Returns:
        True, if the current token is of the given type, or false it's not.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - If there's an error parsing the tokens.

      • expect

        @Nonnull
public Token expect(TokenType... types)
                      throws CarrotException
        Returns a Token if it's one of the given types, or throws a CarrotException if it's not.
        Parameters:
        types - The TokenTypes we want to accept one of.
        Returns:
        The next Token, if it's of the given type.
        Throws:
        CarrotException - If there's an error parsing the token, or if it's not of the given type.

      • end

        public void end()
         throws CarrotException
        Throws:
        CarrotException - unless we're at the end of the tokens.

      • unexpected

        public CarrotException unexpected(java.lang.String msg)
        Creates a CarrotException with the given message, populated with our current state.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to create the exception with.
        Returns:
        A CarrotException with the given message (presumably because we got an unexpected token).
